comments:
1. I terminated an ant build using the red terminate button in the build output 
console
2. I tried to launch a second build
3. I got the error message, which I'll attach as a picture.

Created an attachment (id=3674)
Shows build failed error message

I have logged the invalid thread access problem against platform debug as bug 
32668.

Even with the exceptions, I cannot reproduce your problem. Was this easily 
reproducable?

>Even with the exceptions, I cannot reproduce your problem. 
>Was this easily  reproducable?

Yes. Happens every time during a gcj build(.exe which takes a while):

I tried to make a smaller case, but perhaps the below is a different problem?

I can't abort ant at all.

	<apply failonerror="true" executable="cmd" parallel="true">
			<arg value="/k"/>
			<fileset dir="." excludes="**/*" />
		</apply>
	

?yvind

I can reproduce using ejbdoclet and hitting cancel when the sub task javadoc 
fires up.
In my case, the launch still shows as active in the debug view but you cannot 
terminate or terminate and remove this launch.  Do you see similar?

Another sideeffect:

When I shut down Eclipse, the eclipse.exe + java.exe are left hanging around. 
Go to the task manager and see.

>I can reproduce using ejbdoclet and hitting cancel when the 
>sub task javadoc fires up. In my case, the launch still shows as 
>active in the debug view but you cannot terminate or terminate 
>and remove this launch.  Do you see similar?

Yes. Same thing.

Do you see the dangling eclipse.exe?

?yvind
Yes I see the eclipse.exe hanging around as well.

Verifed with Jared.

Changed the ProgressBuildListener to only cancel if in the same thread (and 
therefore same process).
